alert.note: Alert for Floyd (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued June 30 at 1:05PM EDT by NWS Atlanta
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of southwestern Floyd County through 145 PM EDT... At 105 PM EDT, a strong thunderstorm was over Lyerly, or near Summerville, moving south at 35 mph. HAZARD...Winds up to 40 mph, frequent lightning and heavy rain. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect minor damage to tree limbs and blowing around of light, unsecured objects. Heavy rain may cause temporary street flooding especially in poor drainage areas. Locations impacted include... Rome, Cave Spring, Lindale and Coosa. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.00 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: People outdoors should seek shelter immediately. If you can hear thunder, you are close enough to be struck by lightning. Motorists should slow down and be prepared for possible loss of control due to hydroplaning.
